content.rendered:
Tokeny Insights May 2019

Hello  

Welcome to this month’s edition of Tokeny Insights.

Tokenization is happening. The question is, which assets will be the first to become widely adopted on the blockchain? Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) certainly need easier ways to access global capital and therefore attract a lot of attention. However, defining the value of a company and the risk of investment can be challenging for investors. Most probably, debt instruments will be tokenized first. Bonds and loans are usually simpler financial instruments than equity, as companies can have very complex shareholder agreements.

The European Union (EU) decided to help SMEs benefit from the power of digitization. In July 2018, the EU effectuated a new law, and has allowed companies to raise up to EUR 8 million every 12 months through the use of a prospectus exemption. This means SMEs can directly target European retail investors, with a minimum amount of legal work. To know how much your company can raise with this exemption, you can have a look at our summary.

Last month we launched ST8.fr, a digitized financing initiative designed for French SMEs who are looking to take advantage of this EU regulation. By combining this with blockchain solutions, companies can digitally onboard retail investors and benefit from an increased time to market. We are proud to have launched this fully digital experience with Havas Blockchain and Psion Finance.

If you have any thoughts or questions then let us know. As always, here’s a curated summary of key updates in the security token industry over the past month.

Best wishes,
Luc Falempin
Tokeny CEO

MARKET SPOTLIGHT

Significant news and insights selected by our team of security token experts

 

Fidelity: Institutional Upping Investments in Digital Assets

A report dated May 2nd 2019 from Fidelity Investments revealed detailed survey findings concerning institutional investor interest in digital assets.

Finextra

Read more

 

Societe Generale Issued the First Covered Bond as a Security Token on a Public Blockchain

The French multinational bank issued its first security token, although we don’t know if it’s a permissioned token as Societe Generale didn’t publish the smart contract address.

Societe Generale

Read more

 

FINRA Grants ATS Licensure to SeedInvest

Circle and subsidiary SeedInvest announced that they had successfully applied for, and been granted, an ATS license, allowing the latter to form a secondary market.

Securities.io

Read more

 

LSE collaborates on 20/30 Share Issuance for Blockchain based Security Tokens

London Stock Exchange (LSE) announced it settled around £3 million in tokenized equity on its test environment, LSE Turquoise.

Crowd Fund Insider

Read more

 

ST8 Launched in an Effort to Help French SMEs

We joined forces with Havas Blockchain, Psion Finance to create a digitized finance solution to help SMEs achieve capital investment.

Securities.io

Read more

 

Swiss Exchange Announces Testing of Security Tokens

Switzerland’s stock exchange may issue its own tokens as part of a plan to digitize assets.

Finews

Read more

COMPLIANCE IN FOCUS

Compliance and regulatory news curated by our team of industry insiders

Thailand’s SEC Readies for Digital Trade Amendments

Thailand’s regulatory body has announced market participants to prepare for an amended Securities and Exchange Act of 2019, which will introduce digital trade using blockchain technology.

Bangkok Post

Read more

 

European Union’s Prospectus Regulation To Shake Up The Security Token Industry

The Tokenist reports on the EU regulation that has partially  taken effect, with the remainder of provisions coming into place on 21 July 2019.

Tokenist

Read more

 

Loi PACTE Passed to Enable Digital Asset Issuance

On 11 April, the French government passed legislation to take advantage of blockchain technology and enable SME growth.

Gouvernement.Fr

Read more

Subscribe to the newsletter:

Subscribe
